p: Prevention of arenavirus infection consists of interrupting virus transmission from rodents to humans, and from humans to humans. Rodent control seems to be efficient only in certain conditions (i.e.: urban settings). Hospital based nursing barrier appears highly efficient, including personal protective measures (gloves, masks and gowns), good hygiene and appropriate sterilization of equipment. The highest-risk of infection occurs during unprotected contact with body fluids from an infected person. Linens should be handled per CDC guidelines 5. Environmental surfaces and contaminated equipment are properly disinfected by 1:10–1:100 dilution of sodium hypochlorite or other EPA-registered disinfectants. The viruses can also be inactivated by ultraviolet, gamma irradiation, temperatures of 56 °C for 20 min and, by a pH less than 5.5 or greater than 8.5.
